explanation: a type of table used in ceremonies in a Christian church or in other religious buildings
sentence: Her gaze went to the altar, and she shivered.
sentence_gap: Her gaze went to the _____, and she shivered.

explanation: of or like an eagle; literary
sentence: He is tall and slender, with black hair, dark blue eyes, and an aquiline nose.
sentence_gap: He is tall and slender, with black hair, dark blue eyes, and an ________ nose.

sentence: He clutched a top hat and a silver-topped cane.
sentence_gap: He clutched a top hat and a silver-topped ____.

explanation: a person or thing that has the same purpose as another one in a different place or organization
sentence: The prime minister is to meet his European counterparts to discuss the war against drugs.
sentence_gap: The prime minister is to meet his European ____________ to discuss the war against drugs.

explanation: to stop something before it is finished, or to reduce or limit something
sentence: The lecture was curtailed by the fire alarm going off.
sentence_gap: The lecture was _________ by the fire alarm going off.

explanation: informal; to show that something is less important, less good, or less true than it has been made to appear
sentence: The writer's aim was to debunk the myth that had grown up around the actress.
sentence_gap: The writer's aim was to ______ the myth that had grown up around the actress.

sentence: The two cultures were so utterly disparate that she found it hard to adapt from one to the other.
sentence_gap: The two cultures were so utterly _________ that she found it hard to adapt from one to the other.

explanation: a piece of skin or bone taken from one part of a body and joined to another part
sentence: He has had a skin graft on his badly burned arm.
sentence_gap: He has had a skin _____ on his badly burned arm.

sentence: She's always grousing about how she's been treated by the management.
sentence_gap: She's always ________ about how she's been treated by the management.

sentence: In a few minutes the kindling was burning.
sentence_gap: In a few minutes the ________ was burning.

sentence: Water had percolated down through the rocks.
sentence_gap: Water had __________ down through the rocks.

explanation: (of speech or writing) expressing an idea cleverly in a few words
sentence: A pithy summation, but not an entirely convincing resolution of the dilemma.
sentence_gap: A _____ summation, but not an entirely convincing resolution of the dilemma.

explanation: to lose the determination to oppose something; to accept defeat
sentence: I felt sure it would only be a matter of time before he succumbed to my charms.
sentence_gap: I felt sure it would only be a matter of time before he _________ to my charms.

explanation: has a body that is wide across the shoulders and chest and is short
sentence: A thickset young man appeared in the doorway.
sentence_gap: A ________ young man appeared in the doorway.

explanation: to take people's attention away from someone and make them listen to or look at you instead
sentence: Most supporting bands tend to be youngsters, and rarely upstage the star.
sentence_gap: Most supporting bands tend to be youngsters, and rarely _______ the star.
